response.overview: "Everyone gets a box, in a building, to keep their things that they keep in little boxes. Everything ends up in a box, even us, in a coffin."  Nina's life is dictated by the boxes in her closet. Each action, decision, and resolution are all based on the different boxes that control much of her life - she likes it this way. When one day she finds a second box open, her life spirals into despair. Who's in control now?
response.tagline: "Everyone gets a box, in a building, to keep their things that they keep in little boxes. Everything ends up in a box, even us, in a coffin."
response.title: A Menina das Caixas
